column4: is there a diferent version of ubuntu for dual core prossesors ?
Just use the "smp" kernel (I think it does it by default)
: is there a setting i have to change then cause at system monitor he only shows 1 cpu
I don't know (as I've never tried it), but running "uname -r" will tell you your kernel's name. If it says smp then you should be using however many processors you have (as long as it isn't over 255)
